title: Knifeman accused of stabbing police in shocking brawl is violin prodigy son of Greens councillor
text:
A man who allegedly tried to stab two police officers in a shocking incident of road rage has been revealed as the violin prodigy son of a Greens councillor.

Oliver Scales-Copeland, 25, faced the Newcastle Magistrates Court on Monday charged with two counts of wounding with intent to resist arrest, destroying property and common assault over the incident on Sunday.

His father is George Copeland, a Greens councillor on Waverley Council in Sydney’s east.

Oliver Scales-Copeland (pictured) who allegedly tried to stab two police officers in a shocking incident has been revealed as the violin prodigy son of a Greens councillor

Mr Scales-Copeland faced the court on Monday charged with two counts of wounding with intent to resist arrest, destroying property and common assault over the incident on Sunday

It is alleged one officer was stabbed five times in the leg and the other through his hand as they attempted to detain Mr Scales-Copeland at a Toronto service station.

Officer had confronted the man over reports of a road rage incident at about 1pm on Sunday.

Mr Scales-Copeland expressed his remorse at the alleged attack to the court, ABC News reported.

'I do apologise for what happened and I do regret it, by no means do I have any intent to repeat what I have done,' he told the court.

The alleged offender has chosen to defend himself in court which presented some issues when he took time to understand his charges after they were read out.

'The destroy property, you mean the car tyre, I accept I did that, basically I feel like I can get my life back on track without damaging any person or any property.,' he said.

Registrar Jane Bourne told Mr Scales-Copeland his charged were of a very serious nature and it was on him to explain why he should't be kept in custody until his trial date.

However Ms Bourne said he had failed to provide enough evidence to accept bail and instead it was refused.

'Oh God, please don't do that, I don't need that,' he said upon hearing his bail application was denied.

He is due to appear in court again on Tuesday.
